number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 15, 2015
												I'll give you the TL;DR right away to save you some time: BUY THIS GAME. NOW. (or wait until it's $5, either way, it's worth it)Cons:Buggy. Download the unofficial patch (link in Steam forums), it fixes most of the bugs. I recommend the basic patch on your first playthrough. There's still some bugs after the patch, but just make sure you save a lot. Fixing most bugs is as simple as restarting the game and reloading your save. I only had to do this maybe two-three times with the patch. It's probably more without it. I encountered no game-breaking bugs. I do hear of some people having a hard time getting it running as well. I've never had issues, but the solutions are out there, and the effort is worth it.Clunky Combat. This game tricks you into thinking it's going to be more like an FPS, at first. Disregard. It's fairly straightforward RPG combat via mashing the left-click (with a little more to it as you'll learn). Guns are very weird at first, and melee is a bit hard to grasp right away. I actually quit and uninstalled the game on my first character because of this. I'm very glad I gave it a second chance. Once you get used to it, it's not bad at all. You'll be a ninja in no time, I promise.Character models. This is more of a personal preference, but I think the chracters have a bit too much charicature. They're a bit cartoony as you can see by the screenshots. In spite of that, the game is actually pretty dark, gritty, and sometimes, downright scary. I often forgot all about them while playing.Animations. The animations, especially during cutscenes, are a bit funky. It's bearable, though. And that's just the body animations. The facial animations are pretty good. Great for 2004. The cloth physics are a bit wack.Map size. A pro and a con at the same time, almost. The map is split into fairly small loading zones focused around city hubs and various quest locations. If you're used to more open worlds, it might take a bit to get used to. It doesn't bother me, personally. They do a decent job at filling them with content, even if the content does get a bit thinner in the later maps (a lot of games do this).Pros:Atmosphere. The biggest seller for me in this game. Bloodlines nails it's gothic atmoshere so well, it's almost uncanny. It's horror elements are also very well executed. Not too many games can get my heart racing like this one has. One part in particular, if you don't know what you're doing, is nightmare inducing (Hint: The last screenshot might have something to do with the part I'm referring to).Story. The story is gripping and packed with intrigue. Some of the gameplay elements might get a bit repetitive (as with just about any game), but I was always driven to continue just to see events unfold. Lots of twists and turns. Everything you would want from a VtM story. Some things were a bit obvious, but everything works. There's also multiple endings depending on where you choose to put your loyalty. They ultimately lead to the same place and overall outcome, but this didn't bother me. I found that siding with myself got some of the most epic dialogue and immersion. Every step of the way, you really feel like you're being dragged deeper down into a dark underworld. And don't worry if you're not familiar with the PnP, this game does a great job introducing fledglings to the VtM universe.Characters. Memorable and well voice-acted. They drive the story along flawlessly. Not much else to say about that.Choice. Wanna skulk in the shadows, Gordon Freeman through ventilation systems, picking locks and hack computers to get through? Or do you wanna kick the door in and beat the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of everything with your fists? You got it. Unfortunately, the amount of choice peters off around the halfway mark. Due to Troika having their budget and their deadlines cut by Activision, much of the latter half of the game is very combat heavy. The story and characters don't falter, though. I found stealth and social-focused characters fairly difficult to play later on. In some cases, I even cheated and/or just stopped advancing with those characters. It's a bit disheartening, but it is what it is. You can still enjoy the first half thoroughly, with social or stealth. Just make your first character combat-focused to get the whole story without much of a hitch, then play around with the other stuff in subsequent playthroughs.Music. The music selection is small, but well-produced. They are also in non-propietary formats in the game files, so if you really enjoy them, you can copy them to your preferred device.Replayability. Although the game isn't terribly long, there's plenty of oppurtunity for replay. Playing different clans alters your experience, sometimes dramatically. I recommend a Brujah specializing in Celerity for an easy-mode play through. The Matrix-esque effects of a high Celerity level is pretty neat. The wacky Malkavian makes a great second character (might be hard to follow along with the dialogue for a first-timer). Nosferatu is expert mode. Along with that, the modding community is still undead and well. You can find everything from the basic bug-fixing patches like suggested above, all the way to major game alterations. I state again, I recommend only the basic unofficial patch for a fledgling to minimize bugs/incompatibility frustration.Conclusion:Although both lists have a similar number of entries, I assure you, the Pros FAR outweigh the cons. This is the perfect game to play during the Halloween season (in which it usually goes on sale as well). I can play it any time of day, myself. With CCP plopping their fat asses on the IP with no apparent interest in using it, this is the best VtM game you're going to get for a long time. In extension, I would argue that it's the best vampire game ever made, and sadly, will probably remain so.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 24, 2015
												This is a great game with amazing role playing opportunities but unless you're willing to use unofficial patches and the console to get past issues, choose a different game. On a modern system, this game won't run without an unofficial patch and even then you run into hiccups. Still interested? Well, sit down because I'm going to tell you why this game is the vampire RPG you've been looking for and more.Ever craved more after Skyrim's tiny vampire section? Well, here it is, with fangs and bloodlust to match.This game puts you in the middle of an urban city environment based in 2004. You've been sired by a vampire against the Masquerade and if not for Kindred (vampires) political machinations, you'd be ash alongside your sire.Now, you are thrust into a world of politics, monsters and blood, all whilst hiding your true nature. The clan you pick has a decent factor in on this and some more than others. There are different ways to handle situations throughout most of the game and it's really just near the end where the rewarded path becomes the least successful which is quite discordant.Each situation is very different, leaving very little of that normal copy and paste side quest/main quest situation, giving you a fulfilling storyline to warm your undead heart. Mechanics have you thinking like a vampire- a game where you are the predator and sometimes, the prey don't know how close they were to their death, spared because it was too much effort. Your judgement, skills and so on will determine how you approach things.The penalties for violating the Masquerade by exposing vampiric activities to the Kine (humans) can be severe if you're not careful. Feed on anyone out in the open, use certain powers openly, amusement, even the wrong speech choice can get you in trouble. Five strikes and it's an automatic final death/game over. Humanity Loss, unfortunately with the XP you can spend to undo is a little less dire but be careless and not fix a severe deficit and suddenly you're looking at a frenzy where you literally lose control for a bit. Injury and thirst for blood can bring out the vampiric beast within. Mostly, a savvy player will sidestep these pitfalls but occasionally, you’ll find yourself desperate for blood and a crowd of unwitting humans after a hellish quest so stock up on those spare blood bags.Gameplay can get frustrating and there's no difficulty bar. My best advice to new players is don't get intimidated, and you'll make it through, even if you need to add self-advantage.I won't spoil the main game but the World of Darkness universe is an amazing playground for your vampire RPG-ing wants. You have to play it for yourself and carve out your potential eternal life, although be careful. The wrong side at the end can leave your legacy as a fate worse than death. It’s a game of consequences with logic behind decisions and outcomes based on your choices. Vampire: the Masquerade - Bloodlines is a great vampire RPG, arguably one of the only chances you'll have to play a vampire as they were made to be and it leaves you wondering why more entries couldn't have been made. It is 'the' vampire RPG everyone wishing to sink their fangs into the night must have and the price is worth the gamble to get it running on newer computers.My final score for this game is 9.5/10 and the half point loss is for the bug that required no-clip and the fifteen reloads it took to get through to the next section for an otherwise game breaking bug. Any older game made for XP and earlier you pick up at this point will come with all kinds of issues but this game was released as an unstable beta, requiring years of caring work by Wesp5, who deserves an eternity of gratitude for getting this game to run as well as it does.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 19, 2014
Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines.Long name, incredible game. Quite possibly the best game I have ever played. I have reached the final boss several times, but only finally got around to giving him his Final Death today. Taking around thirty hours, this is a game complete with an amazing story, interesting characters, cool powers, and the most legit vampire's I know of. The basic story begins with your 'embrace' - where you become a vampire - and continues as your rise in power and prestige, until you are causing the events, rather than reacting to them.Each of the nine clans you can choose from have different abilities. They could be considered classes, similar to other games, but they aren't usually wildly different. Most of the change is in the player models, and the powers - each clan getting two powers from a pool, and a third unique to their clan. But there are enough differences to make replaying a possibility. For example, the Nosferatu are hideous, and as such cannot seduce people for blood, and instead have to suck on rats in the sewers below the streets, while the Ventrue clan is the opposite - they cannot drink from rats due to their nobility. Another is clan Malkavian; each and every one of them is insane. Incredibly, they have 100% unique dialogue, opposed to other clans having a few lines or opportunities each, and can engage in some interesting tangents - such as having a conversation with the news reporter on TV.While the vanilla version is very buggy - due to the developers being rushed in their final stages - most of these issues can be resolves with the fan made Unofficial Patch, which is a must-get if you plan on playing. It's not the prettiest game either, with some pretty terrible animations at times, but all this is forgiveable in the face of such a wonderful experience. The game uses Valve's source engine (an earlier version of the engine Titanfall is built on), and was released on the same day as Half-Life 2; and though the models in the game are by no means of equal quality, they are attractive in their own way, and help nail the bleak, horror/noir atmosphere.If Firefly was a game, it would be this one. While the themes are not at all similar, it is the kind of game that when someone brings it up in conversation, or you read about it on the net, you pretty much have no choice but to reinstall and have another crack at it.10/10. I honestly cannot think of any way to improve it, other than give the devs more time to improve a couple of the cutscenes.tl;dr - V:TM-B is one of the best games ever. It is often on sale on Steam. buy it. Install the most recent Unofficial Patch. Enjoy the ♥♥♥♥ out of it.P.S. ♥♥♥♥ the haunted hotel. The game isn't all that scary, the hotel always gets me.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 22, 2014
												Oh boy, where to begin?Vampires : The Masquarade : Bloodlines is one of those games that become classics the moment you turn them on. The closest thing I could relate it to, both in terms of gameplay and overall feeling is the first Deus Ex, as in both games you are some kind of superhuman who gets to master disciplines and powers in an RPG fashion in a game that gives you complete freedom in how to tackle the problems it throws at you (The third Deus Ex could qualify as well, but it tends to make the various intended paths obvious to you right off the bat, rather than letting you think of creative approaches yourself), and each clan (read : Character class) helps complement those playstyles.I'm not really going to say much more, because at this point, you should know whether the game interests you or not, but know this :- Steam only provides the retail version of the game, which is notoriously buggy (not just minor stuff, I'm talking about the game being outright unbeatable or just crashing all the time) because Activision insisted that the game be released the same day as Half Life 2. This version only includes the most critical fixes, like getting the game to start on computers with more than 1GB of video RAM. You definitely should download the unofficial patch (which actually includes "official" fixes) at this adress : http://www.patches-scrolls.de/patch/4647- As enjoyable as I found the experience, the game really begins to lose itself in the last few missions, where levels become longer, much more linear, and where non-combat builds start becoming a lot less viable. The last bosses (which one you get depends on your choices) are especially bad about this, as you probably won't leave a scratch on them unless your combat skills are at least level 8 or 9, but they go down in seconds once they are. Just keep that in mind if you're planning to go down a more non-combat route.- If you go for stealth, prepare for some set pieces to look weird., like enemies busting in through a window or blowing up a wall and then stand there doing nothing.This said, if you're a fan of RPGs, and especially if you liked the first Deus Ex, you owe yourself to play that game.

content:
Posted: July 31, 2011
												Fair warning: this game is incredibly buggy and you will need to install unofficial patches to get it running stably under Windows 7.The piece of advice I see given to new players most often is that you should not play as a Nosferatu or Malkavian during your first playthrough. In the former's case, you are not allowed to be seen by (let alone interact with) human NPCs, turning the game into one of stealth, and in the latter's case, you are literally insane. There is literally an entire game's worth of dialog written exclusively for Malkavian players.This speaks volumes about the game, I feel. The game can play COMPLETELY different depending on your character and the style of play you choose. Because exp is awarded for completing missions, so it doesn't matter whether you progress through persuasion, stealth, or bashing someone's head in. Nobody plays this game just once.tl;dr it's deus ex with vampires

content:
Posted: July 22, 2012
												This is one of the best RPGs ever developed. Seriously just buy it, it's worth the full price. The quality of writing is above and beyond the vast majority of RPGs out there. Most quests are open-ended and have multiple ways to finish them and each of the 7 vampire clans change the way the game is played, giving it a lot of replay value. This game is as good and possibly even better than games like Morrowind and Fallout 2. It was the first game to be developed using the source engine and because of that it holds up well graphically although there are many mods out there that both add content and tweak up the the visuals. This game went unnoticed when it was released, despite recieving a lot of praise and it does deserve all of that praise. This is seriously one of the best RPGs and games ever developed. Stop reading this and just buy it now.Note: It does not work out of the box with Windows 7 or Vista, read my comment below to get it to work.

Posted: December 10, 2014
												You can have an arguement with a stop sign, make peoples blood boil, wear sexy outfits, and dance in clubs this game has almost everything!. Being almost 10 years old (I think), this game really shows its age with outdated graphics, and very buggy gameplay but with a installation of the Unnoficial patcher and some High res mods this game is very enjoyable. You choose one of six Vampire types and then are plunged into the nightlife of a Vampire, however this does not mean that you can go around draining each human like a certain celebrity that i won't name names with free will, you are monitored by the Masquerade. If you reveal your true nature to humans you will be hunted down by vampire hunters and killed, so you have to make sure to only use your powers on enemies in the combat zones or to be careful using your powers in public.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												This is one of those underated games. Even if you don't like fantasy stuff or vampires, this is one game you're going to love especially if you're into First Person Shooters with RPG featutes. Anyone who is into games like Fallout or Skyrim will like this unknown gem. You play as a vampire who was recently turned and a result must learn the ways of the vampire. This isn't your regular vampire game. You must blend in as a human and learn skills that benefit you throughout the game. You gotta learn to hack computers and break into locks along with supernatural abilities like blowing up people by boiling up their blood. Not only is the gameplay fun as hell, but the storyline is actually pretty interesting. Learn about different sects of vampires and choose who to side with. Be wise, as some choices are harder to keep than others.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 11
												It took me years to finally get this game, and when I finally did, I ended up playing it 5x trhough. I've never had so much fun from an outdated game as I had with Bloodlines. I was a huge fan of the game, and with all of the stats that were available, I doubted that they would be able to pull off any balance of abilities that would make the at all interesting, but they pull it off here. Not only are the stats well balanced, but the creators even went so far as to make each clan unique. If you ever do decide to play this game, just know that the Malkavians are unbelievably fun to play. They're the insane clan and their storyline is by far the most interesting. My recommendation is to at least play the game twice. Once with any clan, the second with the Malkavians. Or you can be like me, and just play all the clans. The game, and storyline is just that much fun to go through.

Posted: June 18, 2015
												A fantstic RPG dragged down by a few flaws which are completely fixed by the unofficial patch. This is what RPGs should be. Never mind my play time as I have owned it before my Steam copy and the unofficial patch stops counting your game time. I have gottens hundreds of hours out of this game and still plan on getting hundreds more. Pros:+Beautiful dark modern fantasy world with vampires, werewolves, rock golems, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s+You would be suprised at just how much freedom this game gave players for its time+The Voice acting is nothing short of phenominal+Controls very well+Hours upon Hours of game timeCons:-Combat is lackluster, nothing like, say Morrowind Combat but it could have been better-The second half of the game does get a bit more combat focused- Can't get Jeanette to repeat her introduction speech :( - Never ever getting a sequel :(All in all, if you're not familiar with this game you're in for a treat.If you are well then you know exactly what you're in for so try the newest unofficial patch, it's a great one.

content:
Posted: January 13, 2016
Positive:Great atmosphere via detailed environments, soundtrack and characters.Plenty of fun quests and like all great RPGs, no busywork padding. The focus is on characters and the storyline.Characters can be built around several different playstyles, including sneaking, charisma, melee/ranged combat, etc. The quests incorporate these different choices nicelyGreat voice acting for the most partNegative:No cosmetic character customization like hairstyles or facial features, you only chose gender and clan.The game is a buggy mess out of the box, luckily there's an actively maintained unofficial patch.Combat is a bit clunky, nevertheless fun though.

												It's like skyrim but with vampiresIn all seriousness however this game's greatest strength is it's dialouge and sense of a hidden vampire society. I love the side quests which at times feel more thoguht out than the main quests, the ocean house hotel might be a great feat in game design that not many have noticed. however with all the praise I must however point out the lackiluster melee combat, and late game story missions. I'd recomend this game if you want a game in which you feel like you are part of something massive, and with great story, characters, and dialouge. but I'd skip this one if you are in it for the combat.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 15, 2014
												An urban environment stylized in gothic fashion? Check!Love, loss, and revenge bundled into a tale of personal angst? Check!Dark humor, and a multitude of memorable, well-fleshed out characters with sassy, BAMF, and creepy all represented? Check, checkity, check!The slaying of vampire stereotypes and a glimpse into the humanity and lack thereof in White Wolf's World of Darkness? Depends on your choices, really.But...A level scarier than some Nossies? Twists that might make a Tzimisce look twice? Views and individuals that may entrance a Toreador? You'll get all of this and more!Seriously though, this is one of my top favorite RPGs. The ability to choose from multiple clans and skill sets for your protagonist gives the game a lot of replay value. You're able to unravel different facts and scenarios depending on your choices. Plus, VTMB has superb dialogue (Just ask the Malks! Though the other voices in their head may stifle yours...). I recommend looking for the unofficial patch by Wesp5 that adds to and fixes bugs in the original content though. And although the graphics could be improved, this game was ultimately a wonderful and very fun experience.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 19, 2015
												Before anything, know that you will need an unofficial patch to run this game. I cannot tell you how much of a headache it was not knowing this. After you get past that issue, this game is a must-have.It is a gem of an RPG with tons of replay-ability because almost everything has multiple options you can take in different playthroughs. Most quests have this open ended sort of nature. There is no super protective hand holding here. You are given a goal and that is pretty much it. You can solve every problem in whatever way that you fit. Every type of person is welcome, from the sneaky sneaks to the testosterone fueled run & gunner. Sometimes quests may come with some parameters the quest giver wants. These are mostly optional but you will be penalized (EX: being told to go sneaky but going guns blazing = a scolding)The gameplay is also solid and gives you options as well. Are you a fan of 3rd person melee combat? We got you covered! You a fan of FPS shooting mechanics? We also got you covered too.One of the oddest things that I really enjoyed and respect the most from this game is in character creation. When you start, you get to pick a vampire clan to belong to. Certain clans have certain quirks to being them. For most, it is just minor changes in dialog where people would reference it. The 2 clans that are exceptions to this are the Malkavians and the Nosferatus. Malkavians are usually pretty insightful but it is lodged in crazy while the Nosferatus are so deformed that they should never be seen by humans. So what did the devs do? Malkavian players hear whispers in their ear and are given really insane dialog options for everything that can range from gibberish to cryptic hints for both. Nosferatu characters have negative affects to being seen and must get around using the sewers. This really gives character creation some weight even if it is really these 2 classes that are really affected.There is a bit of a learning curve because not much is explained about your stats for you so you may make a few mistakes early on and, at least for me, there was some issues with direction and finding quests. And if you’re one of those people who prefer graphics over gameplay for some reason, this game isn’t for you. All and all, great game and worth playing through at least once if you don’t get hooked.

												Great game, detailed in-depth storyline.The choices you make in the game follow through with you later on. So you can be a badass that listens to no-one, or be the good little asskisser. The game is similar to Mass Effect in that regard. You can also use different powers like Seduction, Persuasion, Intimidation, etc. You can hack computers, pick locks, etc. It's a very good game even today. It'll have a couple bugs here and there but nothing game-breaking.If you were considering at getting this game, do it. It'll keep you busy for many hours and it's pretty fun and a bit freaky sometimes.Also, there's an unofficial patch out there that'll help update the look of the game somewhat. Make sure you get that :)I'd love to see a sequel to this.

content:
Posted: July 29, 2014
												Such a good game! True its dated, true it needs a patch ( which can be gotten here http://www.patches-scrolls.de/patch/4647/61625/61626/download ) and yes even then some people still have issues running the game on newer systems. But is it worth it. White Wolf has always been one of my favorites when it comes to table top games, and when they made the first Vampire video game ( Vampire: The Masquerade - Redemption released in 2000 for PC ) I played it for ages. Also played the 2 games they released for the xbox for Hunter : The Reckoning. What im trying to say here is I'm a big White Wolf fan so my opinion my be slightly biased. Ether away, the game is great in my opinion. Great story telling, awesome dark atmosphere, and great RPG elements. The combat system is a little clunky but they maybe just due to the fact that in game im still a flegling (new vampire) and still working on my skills. In the end if you are a vampire fan at all, or just a fan of dark evil worlds this game is well worth the money.

												Fantastic game despite its age.  If you can overlook the rather dated (but not horrible) graphics, you'll find a deep well designed rpg in a unique setting.  I'll be honest, I'm not a vampire fan and I really loved this game.  If you like good first / 3rd person rpgs, this is a must have.  Great music, interesting plot with actual choices, the game has about 6 endings plus the combat is challenging but doesn't make you want to punch a wall in frustration.  I find trueblood etc. really corny, but this game is so good it might change your mind about vampire sterotypes.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2014
												After playing this game once as a kid, then trying for the life of me to remember it, I finally found it on Steam and was able to revel in it's glory. The ability to play as so many different types of vampire gives the game an entire different feel with every playthrough. The Malkavian sillyness for a comedic playthrough, the Nosferatu stealthy subterfuge playthrough, or the high-end Toreador ritsy playthrough. You get to see the nuances of each end of the vampire clans. I honestly think this is one of the most underrated games I have ever played, and if you enjoy the FPS RPG type games like any Elder Scrolls game or Fallout game, you would enjoy this game. And if you pick it up and play through it with more than one clan of vampire, and still don't like it, I'll send you a personal apology message.

												Remember when vampires weren't some glittering fairies? VtM:B remember!But seriously, the game is one of the most brilliant RPGs I ever played. So what makes VtM:B so great? Foremost, the gripping plot with twist and turns; secondly, a very balanced (IMHO) grinding-free RPG system; thirdly, the fact that every vampire clan has its unique features and abilities, which means replayability (and lots of it) and last, but not least, the gothic/noirish atmosphere of the setting.

content:
Posted: February 12
												Really, I don't see the need even to review: the game speaks for itself even all these years later. As I write this VTMB is 13 years old and yet it has stood the test of time as being one of the greatest games ever, the sort of a game whose mere mention on a forum can convince *someone* to reinstall it. It's a damn shame Troika went under, CCP cancelled the MMO, and that it was overshadowed by HL2 as they both used the same engine and wanted Half Life out earlier (frankly idgaf about GabeN releasing HL3 or not but if only a new World of Darkness game...) But, then again, Vampire the Masquerade: Bloodlines could just be fated to be one of those games where no studio is ever going to own up to the original. To me, it is like the StarCraft of modern RPGs, where no matter how hard they try all the new material would just be crappy DLCs and an underwhelming experience lacking the true love that went into the first.The good:Painstakingly recreated the original gothic-punk noir atmosphere with the right balance of humor and in-jokes (much akin to the original Fallout games and why Fallout 3 is ridiculed by old fans) and perfect atmosphere. For anyone who's ever been a fan of what White Wolf made with PnP and their novels/source materials, this is great, and serves as an excellent primer and introduction for those that haven't. The soundtrack is awesome. Also very well done for helping set the tone of the whole game.Mood in general is very grimdark in the tragic sense--you get less the feel of "whoa superpowers" and more the grinding tragedy where existentialism may well be the less angsty and horrid option than the ancient being(s) being very plausibly real, with you as ultimately a set piece no matter how bad you think you are (often literally).The storytelling and character interactions. Just superb writing.Replayability: almost every single person to play this game has gone through at least twice, three times being the average. The replay value is possibly the best I've ever seen for a game that actually follows a semi-linear story. Different clans, dialogue options, and playstyles, with the option of multiple endings means you're likely to only see at most 2/3 of the game on your first play through no matter what you do--and that's just the storyline(s). In terms of disciplines (abilities and spells) and various playstyles, one playthrough is probably 1/4 the content. Make sure Malkavians are one of your runs.The Bad:Certain stats are all but useless and things don't translate as well from the PnP. Most common example is loss of humanity, which doesn't affect a whole lot in the game and is fairly easy to replenish which is not like the original content at all. Still, what is lost in translation is probably unnoticeable to anyone not familiar with the setting. The only noticeable parts are things like Seduction which is an almost entirely useless stat.The combat system. It's not actually as horrible as I thought at first especially compared to KoTOR, but it's still pretty bad, although use of firearms is decent enough and for its time isn't really that bad. Besides, if you're looking for a hack and slash this game isn't for you. The main reason is due toBugs. The game wasn't polished at release so needs a patch. My very first run through had a Kuei Jin stuck in mid air as I slashed him helplessly. Most bugs have been fixed otherwise.Lastly it has had a fairly dedicated community including people from the actual project still working on it after release just out of dedication and love for the game, which in its own right should tell you something.10/10 will probably play again after 3 solid runs

												The game itself is dated, from the older style rpg/action style gameplay and advancement.  However I was drawn to it over the years through numerous praise from word of mouth of people I had known who played it.  Once I had the chance to play it for myself I was drawn in.  Literally lost myself in the game and what I could do in the world, when I finally realised it was all connected to some of my favorite P&P worlds of darkness I simply fell in love.  Truly, I recomment this game.  I only ask that once you are done find a nice place to hide because there is no sequel to date or plans that I could find.  Have fun!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 15
												Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines consumed my life for about a week, I was so infatuated with nearly everything about this game that I could easily play for six or more hours, day after day, until I reached the end. Perhaps the most amazing thing about it is that it managed to portray Vampires as cool and powerful, but also genuinely interesting. The characters are wonderfully intriguing and unique and the story managed to draw me in big time while at the same time leaving me guessing as to what's going to happen next, right until the very end. Even though this is undeniably a very rough game with lots of technical problems, at its core it's an extremely engaging RPG that leaves you a lot of room to experience the story any way you like. I'd even go as far as saying this is the RPG companies like Bioware wish they could make and in a way it still is a, for the most part, unsurpassed genre-classic.A must-play for anyone interested in RPGs. (By the way: Playing with an unofficial fan patch (like wesp5's patch) is STRONGLY recommended as it fixes a ton of technical problems.)

Posted: December 10, 2014
												You can have an arguement with a stop sign, make peoples blood boil, wear sexy outfits, and dance in clubs this game has almost everything!. Being almost 10 years old (I think), this game really shows its age with outdated graphics, and very buggy gameplay but with a installation of the Unnoficial patcher and some High res mods this game is very enjoyable. You choose one of six Vampire types and then are plunged into the nightlife of a Vampire, however this does not mean that you can go around draining each human like a certain celebrity that i won't name names with free will, you are monitored by the Masquerade. If you reveal your true nature to humans you will be hunted down by vampire hunters and killed, so you have to make sure to only use your powers on enemies in the combat zones or to be careful using your powers in public.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2015
												I'd like to preface by saying this is the review of the game with the latest unofficial patch by wesp. My applause to wesp.I'm about to be honest and give this great game a hard review. No doubt that this game is quite unique in what it offers, a traditional RPG experience in a dark themed vampire world. The best part of it hands down is the story and the immersive atmosphere of the game. The story and the text is so deep and extensive that you lose yourself just talking to so many characters and getting insight into their stories and background information of the latest happenings.I have a few issues with it so here comes the tough love;1. It is unplayable without the patch2. Even with the patch it has its share of buggy moments3. Combat :(Oh dear. This is what stopped this game from being the my top 5 RPG games of all time; RPG being my favourite genre of games. It really kills the immersion and knocks down a potentially near perfect game (for its time). The combat is just so wonky and I wouldn't take issue with this if the game was a lot more focused on interaction in the world, solving mysteries and story driven. However a decent chunk of the mission design is combat based and its painfully bad to the point where I just took every shortcut and option possible to avoid it, including console commands later in the game because I hated the combat so much. I could go into more detail, but I'll leave it at that.4. Furthermore the game is a little clunky in places as you go through it and I've had a few times where the game just freezes.5. I also had to do additional tweaking of the game just to prevent motion sickness by adjusting FOV, resolution and playing 3rd person often when I felt a little sick (despite FOV fix)6. There are sound issues that have to be also seperately addressed in settings to prevent echoingStory 10/10Graphics (doesn't mater)Gameplay (8.5/10)Controls (♥♥♥♥ed)If you have the time and energy to give modify this game with the official patch and tweak it to get it running properly you will 100% enjoy this game if you're an RPG fan, however those who are new to PC gaming or steam I'd avoid it because of the modifications neccessary for optimal experience. I'd only recommend this game with the patch and tweaks!Final Verdict: 8/10 Overall. Solid experience with an excellent story, brought down unfortunately by the controls and combat. Takes a spot in my top 10 RPG games.

content:
Posted: January 11, 2016
												The strongest points of this RPG are without any doubt it's fantastically dark atmosphere and the charm of the NPC's. By using the Source facial animation the developers have surpassed themselves by providing lively expressions for each meaningful characters, an extra surplus being the great voice acting. What characters say is impressive too, you're gonna laugh with guys like Jack or Fat Larry or you just feel that a person is trying to win you over (what doesn't necessarily needs to be done with speech, Jeanette's and VV's 'attributes' on their own may be enough ... for some of you). Rest assured that these dialogues will keep you busy for a long time without getting boring. The people on the streets and in buildings aren't worked extensively and usually don't do much more than just walking around, you can't even talk with them. They're just dumb, moving bags of blood.

content:
Posted: January 9, 2016
												37 hours. 37 hours that I played this game without much sleep at all. Am I becoming a vampire?Damn, I didn't even do all of the sidequests. I have to go back.This is one of the best RPG's I ever played, and I hate RPG's. Vampires without bling-bling, why is this not a thing anymore? The soundtrack is just amazing. There are glitches here and there, but they are fun. Nothing about being in the midst of a boss battle, very close to dying and having the boss being stuck on the floor. Come and get it!I saw the dancing werewolf. Got rid of that annoying turnstyle. Who's that taxi driver? Am I holding the phone or am I not?The unofficial community patch is highly recommended. It adds the library mission, which is fun. And much more content the original dev's didn't have time to add - for example, whole new characters and voiceovers.I will play this again and try to do all the sidequests. There are easily 50 hours of gameplay in here, totally worth the price.

content:
Posted: February 26, 2014
												There are no words for this RPG, mostly because it's so awe-inspiring even in its imperfection that I can't imagine how it would have been had Troika had ample time, resources and manhours to develop their vision fully. This is one of the adaptations truest to the World of Darkness lore, and all around one of the greatest PC RPGs to ever come out pretty much. Everything, from the visual design, music, quest lines, story, to the fantastically deep character trait customization, disciplines, mission variety, presence of genuinely great NPCs and some stellar voice acting comes together to form a shining star, shrouded by a layer of fog in some parts. Get the latest Unofficial patch and play this, because there is still no game like it to this day.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 30, 2015
												One of the best games ever made.Good/neutral/evil, stealth, magic ("disiplines"), guns, melee, hand to hand, exploration, different endings and lots and lots of multiple choice, very well-voiced conversations (Fallout 4's female PC for example) make this a true gem of a shooter RPG.The game still holds up today easily. Use the patch (not plus, at least not on first (few) playthroughs) and enjoy 1920x1080, where the only slight minus are the 10 year old graphics (see screens on store page). Choose FPS or third, or alternate instantly as you like. It It has truly incredible replay value, as there are multiple ways of building a character AND seven different "classes" (different types of vampire). XP are not given for kills, but for resolving situations (killing everything that moves is one way of resolving pretty much any situation though, but frequently not the only way). Get it! You won't regret it for a second!(BTW I own the original CDs and have finished the game as every character, most more than once, except the Nosferatu. I bought the Steam version recently simply for convienience, so I have many many many more hours in the game than shown here.)

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												This is one of those underated games. Even if you don't like fantasy stuff or vampires, this is one game you're going to love especially if you're into First Person Shooters with RPG featutes. Anyone who is into games like Fallout or Skyrim will like this unknown gem. You play as a vampire who was recently turned and a result must learn the ways of the vampire. This isn't your regular vampire game. You must blend in as a human and learn skills that benefit you throughout the game. You gotta learn to hack computers and break into locks along with supernatural abilities like blowing up people by boiling up their blood. Not only is the gameplay fun as hell, but the storyline is actually pretty interesting. Learn about different sects of vampires and choose who to side with. Be wise, as some choices are harder to keep than others.

content:
Posted: April 11
												It took me years to finally get this game, and when I finally did, I ended up playing it 5x trhough. I've never had so much fun from an outdated game as I had with Bloodlines. I was a huge fan of the game, and with all of the stats that were available, I doubted that they would be able to pull off any balance of abilities that would make the at all interesting, but they pull it off here. Not only are the stats well balanced, but the creators even went so far as to make each clan unique. If you ever do decide to play this game, just know that the Malkavians are unbelievably fun to play. They're the insane clan and their storyline is by far the most interesting. My recommendation is to at least play the game twice. Once with any clan, the second with the Malkavians. Or you can be like me, and just play all the clans. The game, and storyline is just that much fun to go through.

content:
Posted: January 25
												Vampire the Masquerade, though an old game, is a pretty good game for its time. The story is gripping and exciting, causing me to have some sleeplees nights trying to complete the many missions in the game. It also involves a world filled with werewolves, humans and demons living together in a delicate balance of survival and peace.The story goes like this. When you were bitten by a vampire. you became one. A clan leader took you under his arm and ordered you to perform many missions. Without giving away too much of the story, you will eventually come across three main factions, each with its own ideals and belief. Your decisions in the game will eventually lead to an outcome favourable to one of the faction.The controls are average. The first 10 hours was great. However, at the later stages, the game becomes repetitive as you travel to and fro from your apartment just because of the 'emails'. You will also encounter some bugs but these can be solved by reloading the game. The graphics are really dated but viewable.Game satisfaction is 76%.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2012
												If you like Deus Ex and Knights of the Old Republic (KotOR), you're gonna love Vampire the Masquerade: Bloodlines (VtM:B). The thing it shares with those games are great dialogue and voice acting (VtM:B has the best I've ever heard), great and long story as well as several ways of completing a quest. Like KotOR you have different classes, called clans here, but VtM:B offers seven clans, some more different than others. Each clan have three Disciplines (supernatural powers) and there are also a variety of melee and ranged weapons. Like Deus Ex, you can sneak your way through a lot of the game and hack computers and pick locks.  It was a diamond in the rough when it came, but thanks to years of unofficial patches, it's finally what it was meant to be. I'd recommend the latest unofficial patch, currently  v. 8.4, but mods that run on earlier versions of the patch are great as well.Apart from the lengthy singleplayer story (no multiplayer), it has strong mod support and there are even new mods in the making after all this time. I can't express enough how much I love this game and everything about it.There is another VtM game called Redemption, from 2000, which is set in the same world, but it is more of a Diablo-like RPG. It's cheap at GoG and I highly recommend it, but it's quite different from Bloodlines.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 9, 2015
												An underrated FPS/Third Person Hybrid Action RPG game like this are not to be missed. Sure, it's not for everyone, but if you love vampires and the Old World of Darkness universe from White Wolf. Get the game today and you'll learn about this wonderful underrated gem for it's unique depth and setting. This game is and still does supress most modern games out there for it's immersive storyline, plot, voice acting, and believable unforgettable characters. In fact, VtMB is one example that voice acting is very important for games as well as design. It's well worth it! Just make sure you download the latest Unofficial Patch and try out some mods to alter the gameplay and mechanics if you played game so many times. This game never gets old like a great classic attraction from Disneyland. Even though it is not for Disneyland! I've been playing since early 2007! I bought this underrated game on Amazon when it was pretty cheap in phyiscal form. The boxed retail version includeds a manual, 3 PC-CD discs, and a free soundtrack from a Best Buy preorder. I still have my physical copy!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 6, 2016
												The world Troika built is fantastic, and absolutely oozing with the kind of atmosphere you want in a Vampire RPG. At one point in the game, you'll appear in a room in Santa Monica. I personally sat there for like an hour just listening to the news on the tv, and then listening to Deb of Night on the radio. it's the kind of thing that really brings the game to life. I tuned in every so often to check if there were any new stories. There's also a lot of really memorable characters in Vampire: The Masquerade. All of whom are wonderful to meet, good, evil, or in between. I really liked the setting as well, the game world you get to explore has a really interesting aesthetic that channels gothic horror. From Santa Monica to Chinatown, all the locations have a wonderful look to them. Some with a run-down 80s aesthetic to them that reminds me of The Terminator (1984) and Escape From New York. The asian locations feel like something out of a John Woo movie. They're all great. A lot of the businesses and buildings have really interesting or funny names too, that I just love. The OST is mainly different genres of rock, and is pretty cool, I definetly enjoyed it as well. That's not to say that it is without problems though. While the characters are all mostly well written, and well voiced, a lot of the voices seem to suffer from some audio issues, like some characters randomly talking way too quietly, or sometimes seeming to be talking into a tin can. The character progression isn't stellar either. You only gain experience from completing quests and objectives, and instead of levels, you directly use experience to purchase points in various skills and abilities. Which doesn't sound all that bad, but you don't get to use a skill point that often, and most the changes are negligible. Another thing annoyed me was doors. Walking through doors is a pain. You have to wait for the door to open completely, and it opens very slowly. If you try to go through while it's opening, you'll get stuck in the door way. The combat in this game is action based, and isn't that good either. In fact you'll probably try to avoid it in your playthrough using stealth and the social mechanics. This game is very bittersweet, on one hand the setting is really amazing, and the characters and places in this game are lovely. On the other, Troika being forced to publish the game before it was finished makes it suffer from bugs that make it unplayable (Unless you have Wesp5's Unofficial Patch), and lack of content. It seems like the city zones could have potentially been bigger and better, if Troika had enough time. As they are, they're still great, but in the back of your mind you won't be able to help thinking what could have been, with more npcs wandering about, more places to visit, and more to do. Do I recommend this game? Yes. Even with all its problems, I'd still say that it is an absolute classic and there isn't really another game like it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 20, 2012
												If you like Deus Ex and Knights of the Old Republic (KotOR), you're gonna love Vampire the Masquerade: Bloodlines (VtM:B). The thing it shares with those games are great dialogue and voice acting (VtM:B has the best I've ever heard), great and long story as well as several ways of completing a quest. Like KotOR you have different classes, called clans here, but VtM:B offers seven clans, some more different than others. Each clan have three Disciplines (supernatural powers) and there are also a variety of melee and ranged weapons. Like Deus Ex, you can sneak your way through a lot of the game and hack computers and pick locks.  It was a diamond in the rough when it came, but thanks to years of unofficial patches, it's finally what it was meant to be. I'd recommend the latest unofficial patch, currently  v. 8.4, but mods that run on earlier versions of the patch are great as well.Apart from the lengthy singleplayer story (no multiplayer), it has strong mod support and there are even new mods in the making after all this time. I can't express enough how much I love this game and everything about it.There is another VtM game called Redemption, from 2000, which is set in the same world, but it is more of a Diablo-like RPG. It's cheap at GoG and I highly recommend it, but it's quite different from Bloodlines.

I still have my physical copy!

content:
Posted: March 16
												VTMB is by far one of the greatest rpg's ever made. I have replayed it so many times and I still am not tired of it yet. Santa Monica through Hollywood are my favorite parts of the game. I think that it was such a terrible trajedy that this game was so rushed and they weren't able to fully finish it and give it the full potential. With the unnoficial patch, this fixes many of the bugs and restores cut or rushed content. I would also reccomend the clan quest mod, which is phenominal in of itself. I am a huge rpg fan, but I despise what games have turned into. "Rpg's" today have become nothing more than dull writing, "go here, kill, come back" with no depth, choices, moral dilemas, different routes of doing something, etc. These are what make an rpg good in my opinion. VTMB shines in these areas. The writing is superb and at many times hilarious. The atmosphere is dark and gothic, and makes me quite nostalgic. There are actual moral dilemas, choices, and depth. This very may well be the last of it's kind, and I will play this game possibly to my final days. This masterpiece is the last remenent of what true rpgs and good games are. I recommend this to anyone that enjoys games that I have described. Just make sure to get the latest version of the unnoficial patch for bug fixes and restored content. I think it's so amazing that people are still keeping this game alive even to this day.

												It took me years to finally get this game, and when I finally did, I ended up playing it 5x trhough. I've never had so much fun from an outdated game as I had with Bloodlines. I was a huge fan of the game, and with all of the stats that were available, I doubted that they would be able to pull off any balance of abilities that would make the at all interesting, but they pull it off here. If you ever do decide to play this game, just know that the Malkavians are unbelievably fun to play. They're the insane clan and their storyline is by far the most interesting. My recommendation is to at least play the game twice. Once with any clan, the second with the Malkavians. Or you can be like me, and just play all the clans. The game, and storyline is just that much fun to go through.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25
												Vampire the Masquerade, though an old game, is a pretty good game for its time. The story is gripping and exciting, causing me to have some sleeplees nights trying to complete the many missions in the game. It also involves a world filled with werewolves, humans and demons living together in a delicate balance of survival and peace.The story goes like this. When you were bitten by a vampire. you became one. A clan leader took you under his arm and ordered you to perform many missions. Without giving away too much of the story, you will eventually come across three main factions, each with its own ideals and belief. Your decisions in the game will eventually lead to an outcome favourable to one of the faction.The controls are average. The first 10 hours was great. However, at the later stages, the game becomes repetitive as you travel to and fro from your apartment just because of the 'emails'. You will also encounter some bugs but these can be solved by reloading the game. The graphics are really dated but viewable.Game satisfaction is 76%.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 25, 2016
												A true cult classic. This game, though doubtlessly flawed, manages to accomplish creating an atmosphere of such high quality that few other games come close to equalling it. The immersion is top notch, as the game builds a believable and haunting environment. L.A. serves as a thin curtain veiling some of the most disturbing and macabre locations and mysteries that I've ever seen in a video game; sub-plots contain anything from plague-spreading cults to cursed snuff tapes, and all of the stories the player partakes in are memorable and unique. Players have a plethora of choices on how they will accomplish their goals (for the most part; some of the end-game content is poorly designed in this regard, likely due to the numerous development issues that Troika underwent), and player input is respected greatly. This game, like the original Deus Ex, involves its players in its world in meaningful ways (as proper RPGs are meant to, in my opinion).If you are looking for a game with a deep narrative and an intriguing world, then look no further. For all its flaws (combat and bugs, primarily), Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines accomplishes things that are rarely realized this well in the gaming industry. Troika created a masterpiece, and despite some hickups, it is absolutely worth playing.

It'll also require a system restart, so save anything you're working on before you do it.Have fun, feed well.

												This is one of my all time favorite games.  To me, it is one of the best action RPG's made.  The setting and music are great.  It's worth it just for the sound track.  The mechanics for advancing your character are simple, but require thought.  I love that you can play this game almost any way you want: as a shooter, a melee hack and slash, as a dialog adventure, as a stealth assassin...  As vampire lores go, White Wolf's lore is one of the best along with all the other World of Darkness lore hinted at in the game.  Somebody should license the IP from CCP to make a huge, big budget single player sequel to this game.  If you like vampires and ARPG's, this is it.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 7, 2014
												Bloodlines did a great job of capturing the dark, off-putting atmosphere inherent to the World of Darkness. It goes from humorous, but unstable characters to supernaturally unnerving very well and is a generally enjoyable experience. Unsurprising since its based off a pen-and-paper RPG, but the roleplaying experience is very fulfilling and your characters will develop as you see fit.However, there are a couple noticeable problems with the game. The melee combat is a little wonky and a little difficult to control to the degree one desires. There are a couple of "filler" points in the game where a level extends further than necessary for atmosphere and story-telling purposes. And without patches, the game is unstable.But despite these flaws, the game is definitely worth picking up and playing if you like the World of Darkness, pen-and-paper RPG games, or just like an appropriately dark take on vampire legend.

content:
Posted: October 28, 2011
												"Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines" is easily one of the best RPGs I have ever played. I bought it originally in 2004 when it came out, but bought it now on Steam just to have another copy. It's that good. I seriously cannot do enough to recommend it to anybody who has even the most microscopic interest in RPGs. If you like vampires and White Wolf franchises in the World of Darkness, it's an absolute must-buy.If you do buy it, however, you should be prepared to download the official 1.2 patch, or the famous Unofficial Patch by Wesp5. The game does have a few bugs, but either of those patches will solve them. Combat is also a little repetitive, but challenging for all the Clans; it's a mix of point-and-shoot and slice-and-dice melee. However, the game truly shines in its application of the setting and characters, all of which are representative of the World of Darkness, the larger world setting in which vampires, ghosts, werewolves, and all the nightmares of humankind are made real.

content:
Posted: December 27, 2015
												This is one of the best games I've ever played, and I've played it a year ago for the first time so you can believe me when I say it's not nostalgia talking. I am a huge vampire fan and for my entire life I've waited for a game like this, not knowing it was right under my nose the entire time. It is totally worth the full price, and it gets %75 on every sale so there's literally no reason not to buy this.Pros:A great story, accompanied by characters you'll love or love to hatePretty dark  world that feels gothic, even though it's just Santa Monica at nightAged well, graphics would not bother you at all if you're not obsessd with next gen stuff etcGameplay is pretty nice and gives you lots of different options about how to play. You can even finish lots of quests with speechcraft. Adds replayability to the gameIt is pretty realistic, you can't go around butchering people like there's no tomorrow since you'll lose humanity and succumb into the beast, if you try to play like not drinking any blood you'll die. You can even role play and drink the blood of animals/blood packs.Cons:With some builds you can't go too far in the game. Like if you only skilled bloodmagic as your combat choice you can't get passed the sewer episode since creatures there won't give you any blood.Even though the story was great, the ending kinda felt rushed.Game needs to be patched manually before it can be played(not exactly a con, just wanted to point it out)So long story short, BUY THE ♥♥♥♥ING GAME YOU WON'T REGRET IT

												The game is brooding, dark, and seductive, just like a vampire :D.  If you like the World of Darkness, or very dark and bloody vampires, this is the game for you. It has amazing music, wonderful atmosphere, and genuine heart. You can play the game very different ways, including flinging potent spells, stealthing, using insanity or seduction as a form of attack, or stalking the streets as a feral beast.It also has a number of flaws, including a weak combat system and rushed level design in the later parts of the game. Still, the flaws in the game are worth overcoming to enjoy the amazing atmosphere.

content:
Posted: October 28, 2011
												"Vampire: The Masquerade - Bloodlines" is easily one of the best RPGs I have ever played. I bought it originally in 2004 when it came out, but bought it now on Steam just to have another copy. It's that good. I seriously cannot do enough to recommend it to anybody who has even the most microscopic interest in RPGs. If you like vampires and White Wolf franchises in the World of Darkness, it's an absolute must-buy.If you do buy it, however, you should be prepared to download the official 1.2 patch, or the famous Unofficial Patch by Wesp5. The game does have a few bugs, but either of those patches will solve them. Combat is also a little repetitive, but challenging for all the Clans; it's a mix of point-and-shoot and slice-and-dice melee. However, the game truly shines in its application of the setting and characters, all of which are representative of the World of Darkness, the larger world setting in which vampires, ghosts, werewolves, and all the nightmares of humankind are made real.

												Where to even begin...First off, this game is incredibly unique. This is the ultimate role-playing experience. I am 100% serious! And if you sell your soul to the devil in real life in order to gain the ability to actually be bored by this game, you're in luck. The community for this game is incredibly strong and there are tons of mods and additions that you can install for this game. content:
Posted: September 29, 2014
												Personal rating: 9/10 - 10/10 with unoffical patches. Replayability: HighBudget: Worth it. Lenght: A few days to a week. This game is probably more interesting to people who've played the old Vampire the Masquerade Pen & paper roleplaying games, but takes a lot of liberties with the setting to create a good FPS and RP game. Fps combined with RP isn't the most common setup, typically seen mostly with Elder Scrolls, Might and Magic and this particular title. The game of course also features third person view. I'd say they pull it off rather well in this game. Initially, the game was severely bugged and in some cases the game would break in a way that prevented the player from advancing in the game, having to start over from scratch due to having done something at some point... But the unofficial patches fix the game up to the point where this isn't an issue any more. Story wise, and gameplay wise, the game is almost unmatched by other roleplaying titles. I've rarely seen a game that hit the nail on the head this well for setting. The actual game also feels very good. Despite having deviated from the original vampire setting in many ways to provide a smoother game experience (also a simpler one), in ways that might be unforgivealbe to hardcore fans, I find that the this compromise is acceptable. Having played through this game several times, I can honestly say that it's one of the best games I've played. The way quests work, and especially the "horror" elements in the game are worthy of praise.

content:
Posted: October 20, 2015
												This is officialy the best Vampire game ever created. It belongs to a good RPG, horor (creepy kind of horor, no jumpscares) and belive me or not, even the comedy genre. It haves a huge replay value since you have multiple kind of Vampires (clans) you can play as, and they are all different. The biggest spotlight get the caln Malcavian and Nosferatu.Malcavians because their dialoge options are completly different,  they are all completly insane not to mention speaking to the STOP sign and news reporter over TV, xD.Nosferatu because of their ugliness you will get a lot of hilarious reactions from NPCs but the penalty for it is you wont be able to do some quests. Technicly, Nosferatu are like the HARD mode for this game.It haves a many endings so watch the story and try to make good desicions!And just to mention this is NOT the Twilight teen Vampire♥♥♥♥♥♥ this is some serious Vampire♥♥♥♥♥♥ Now that's done here's the Pros and Cons:Pros:-Replay value-Very fun combat mecanics-Mucis makes the creepy dark atmosphere even more better.-Very interesting and special side quests-Main story is greeat-RPG part is very well made-Vampiric powers are awesome and very helpfull and different for every Clan-Characters are interesting-I never saw better dialoge options in any video game i ever played in my life and i played them a lot. The cool thing is that every character makes deep facial exsprecions for every sentance they say.-Cool easter eggs-and other....Cons:-Otdated graphics (2003)-Random NPC are same in every place ( i once saw 5 women looking exacly the same o-o)-Combat music is very repetitive (but you can get used to it)-Bugs, since game was rushed.-You'll find your self going on internet so see some solutions for quests, since some quests get you more exsperience if you beat them on different way, hidden treasures ect.-Needs the unoficial patch, but it's a quick job not problem at all.Overall it's a must play game, shame it never got a sequel :) And watch youre♥♥♥♥♥when you get to the Seeside Hotel in Santa Monica...

												One of the best Action-RPG's I've ever seen.  Doesn't age at all.Awesome soundtrack, great plot, including side-quests, non-linear gameplay, a variety of classes and skills.Each clan has its own style, they are typically divided into classic groups: warrior, mage, marksman, thief, the-one-who-talks etc. I recommend to play with Malkavian or Nosferatu on your SECOND try, as the difficulty with these clans is higher due to their appearance and manner of speech. number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 26, 2013
												+Good Story+Good Voice Acting+Good Atmosphere+Great RPG Elements (Race, Skills, Items)+Varied Gameplay (stealth, lockpicking, hacking, combat, conversation)+Good Conversation Choice system-Weak Combat-Uneven PacingI have a love / hate relationship game.  From my perspective, you have a game that is very much like the original Deus Ex in terms of choice by in-game actions or conversations mixed with a compelling atmosphere perfect for the location and time period of the story.  Being able to make various choices or alternate routes of completing goals is awesome.  The 90s pop / gothic vampire cults imbued in Southern California culture is convincing and enjoyable.Unfortunately, there are some design decisions that prevent it from being the same great addicting experience that is Deus Ex.  The combat is lousy.  While Deus Ex has aged in terms of gunplay, there are at least mechanics to perform instanteous lethal kills or knockouts.  While stealth holds up with human foes, it is somewhat hindered in my point of view by the third person perspective that is forced when equipped with a melee weapon.  When firing at an aware NPC, the combat feels similar to a bullet sponge FPS with no ADS.  Think Halo.  This would not be a problem if you did not get forced into critical situations requiring combat, however, there are boss fights that must be completed throughout the main quest.Combat aside, the game has trouble with pacing.  Some times you can become stuck trying to find an item or clue that will set you off on the next thread of the main quest.  While tinkering around the world is enjoyable, being lost in 90s computer records is not great.Anyways, I think this game should definitely be played.  Buy it when on sale and dedicate 6 hours of game time before calling quits.  Also, spending time with a character creation guide to make the most of your skills and vampire powers is advised.[GET AT SALE]

content:
Posted: April 10, 2015
												10/10 with the True Patch. The best ARPG I've played. Seven distinctive classes (read: bloodlines, get it?) and a complex network of attributes, talents and disciplines send players through unique story archs, creating genuinely exciting replay potential. Impactful decision-making, above average dialogue and tough, ultraviolent combat combine to create a level of immersion rarely attained in all video gaming. The GTA-style open world is packed with fun, story-driven quests that span a broad spectrum of level designs, some of which are among my favorite to date (many are truly terrifying), all of them teeming with World of Darkness's inspired takes on classic horror creatures. The "feeding" logic is immensely satifying. Add the inventive weapons and gear and the result is an unprecedented completeness of world building. Easily one of my favorite games, period.The game is sexist and racist, which sucks because it really is among of the greatest of all time. The sole black NPC wears a basketball jersey, sports an afro, refers to women as "baby girl" and, in conversation, when he invites the player to eat with him, there is a dialogue option that reads: "Couldn't I just watch the monkeys feed down at the zoo?"...Not funny! This and the gleefully violent sexual rhetoric in many of the in-game emails (and general objectification of women characters) suggest a troubling level of depravity on the part of the staff at Troika and Activision.

Posted: November 28, 2016
												     Greetings, First off I want to say that this game is old and like many old games in this new touch screen world getting them to play nice with Win 10 can be easier said than done. With that out of the way lets dig in.     This game had so much long term potiential and its sad that after Troika finished it they closed their doors. I was really looking forward to the expansion that would have came. Compared to Vampire: The Masquerade-Redemption, Bloodlines was From dusk till dawn the movie not the seires.      The story line was very intricate with alot of nice twists. The characters were lively also some of them took me back to the pen and paper days. I really digged the musical score. It really vibed well with the mood and settings of the game. Aside from the technical difficulties this game is a steal at its current pricing. If your looking for a laid back rpg and dont mind the graphics throwback you should give it a try.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: February 8, 2015
												....But seriously, play this game is all I'll say as the bottom line. Vampire the Masquerade: Bloodlines has one of the best voice acting I've heard in video games from the sheer amount of life breathed into each character. This game has something for everybody and may try way too hard in some places but makes up for it with variety, fun, and creative level designs that become familiar rather quickly. After installing the unofficial patch to fix this game, it becomes one of the best games you'll play from the 2000's. Take it as an RPG/Dialogue sim or make it a FPS, there's no wrong way to play this game and it'll give you enough option to try as many routes as you want without much repetition outside of the main storyline. Buy it, play it, then play it again in a completely different way and as a completely different class - this game will let very few players down. Pros:+High replayability including multiple endings and a GOOD variety of classes/clans. +Excellent Voice Acting+Decent Combat System+Great Environments+Memorable Characters+Great Writing and an interesting plot+Informative menus and inventories with a quest logCons:-Bugged as hell (fixed with the unofficial patches)-Music is pretentious and laughable and sounds like somebody compressed three entire Hot Topics into a soundtrack-Backtracking becomes tedious

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 10, 2015
												10/10 with the True Patch. The best ARPG I've played. Seven distinctive classes (read: bloodlines, get it?) and a complex network of attributes, talents and disciplines send players through unique story archs, creating genuinely exciting replay potential. Impactful decision-making, above average dialogue and tough, ultraviolent combat combine to create a level of immersion rarely attained in all video gaming. The GTA-style open world is packed with fun, story-driven quests that span a broad spectrum of level designs, some of which are among my favorite to date (many are truly terrifying), all of them teeming with World of Darkness's inspired takes on classic horror creatures. The "feeding" logic is immensely satifying. Add the inventive weapons and gear and the result is an unprecedented completeness of world building. Easily one of my favorite games, period.The game is sexist and racist, which sucks because it really is among of the greatest of all time. The sole black NPC wears a basketball jersey, sports an afro, refers to women as "baby girl" and, in conversation, when he invites the player to eat with him, there is a dialogue option that reads: "Couldn't I just watch the monkeys feed down at the zoo?"...Not funny! This and the gleefully violent sexual rhetoric in many of the in-game emails (and general objectification of women characters) suggest a troubling level of depravity on the part of the staff at Troika and Activision.

content:
Posted: July 26, 2016
												The game is one of the most immersive RPGs' I have ever played, I connected with it's dark atmosphere, gritty settings, well developed characters and the White Wolf License. This game faced disaster when it first came out on the same day as Half-Life 2 back in 2004. Firstly releasing it against one of the most influential games was obviously going to side-line it, but, secondly the game wasn't finished by the time Activision decided to push it out; as a result it went into the wind, unheard of. I must state that I play games for their stories' and immersion, while some people may find other mediums of entertainment such as TV and Film to indulge in better stories; this game did not disappoint. The story of the Vampire clans vying for control in L.A and the underlying plot about a certain object is well thought out and crafted, supported by top-notch voice acting; all thanks to the Source engine. Graphically this game may look dated now that we are in 2013, but don't be fooled it still captures the gritty setting perfectly. The gameplay may also be dated, however as stated I mainly play games for their stories' and as a result tend not to focus on 'high' graphics and 'great' game-play. (I'm not saying it isn't integral of course). Speaking of the gameplay, the amount of variations that are found in the different vampire clans is fresh. For example if you play as a mad-stricken Malkavian, this may open up specific dialogue options and immersive events; and that's not even including the different powers and abilities. The game design isn't open-world, but boy it is fun to explore! The side-quests may not be as numerous as the ones' found in Skyrim or other top RPGs'. However the quests in VTMB are rich, immersive and are genuinely fun to play. Overall I find this game to be in my top 30, and would recommend this game to anyone who likes fresh, original, and immersive stories coupled with vampire fiction and good but not revolutionary game-play.
